# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/rich/_pick.py
@source-hash: 7af0edf10378945e
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:59:51Z

## Purpose
Utility module providing boolean value selection logic for the Rich library. Implements a "first non-None" selection pattern commonly used for configuration defaults and optional parameter resolution.

## Key Functions
- **`pick_bool(*values: Optional[bool]) -> bool`** (L4-17): Selects the first non-None boolean value from a variadic argument list, or returns the last value converted to bool if all are None.

## Implementation Details
- Uses assertion-based validation requiring at least one input value (L13)
- Iterates through values in order, returning first non-None boolean (L14-16)
- Fallback behavior converts the last value to bool using `bool()` constructor (L17)
- Supports any number of Optional[bool] arguments via `*values` unpacking

## Dependencies
- `typing.Optional` for type annotations (L1)

## Usage Pattern
Typical use case is configuration cascading where multiple optional boolean sources need to be resolved to a single definitive boolean value, with None representing "not set" states.
